definition: to drool (over) (idiom)/to yearn for/to covet/to crave
to hang (down)/droop/dangle/bend down/hand down/bequeath/nearly/almost/to approach
saliva
surname San
three/3
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]

sentences.english: His mouth watered at the sight of roast.
sentences.chinese: 他看見烤肉就垂涎三尺。

sentences.english: I am slobbering all over you.
These old stamps are eagerly coveted by collectors.
sentences.chinese: 收藏家們對這些舊郵票都垂涎三尺。

sentences.english: Peter coveted his neighbor's farm but could not get her to sell it.
sentences.chinese: 彼德對鄰居的田產垂涎三尺，但卻沒辦法讓她賣掉它。

sentences.english: "The Coppa Italia final is an extraordinary appointment for us - we were not expecting it, " Marotta told Radio Anchio Sport.
sentences.chinese: 儘管出乎意料，我們對意大利杯冠軍還垂涎三尺。

sentences.english: All the other guys in Maui are drooling over this girl.
sentences.chinese: 毛伊島上所有的傢伙都對這個女孩垂涎三尺。

sentences.english: Drool with envy to little Joe , hence the week Yu moved to kill the heart of various Ge.
sentences.chinese: 對於小喬垂涎三尺，於是周瑜就動了殺諸葛的心。

definition: to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
to water at the mouth/to drool
lit. to drool with desire (idiom)/fig. to hunger for/greedy
to covet/to envy
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to make one's mouth water/appetizing/greedy person/glutton
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
to covet/to long for/to lust after
a feast for the eyes (idiom)/(of women) gorgeous/graceful/(of scenery) beautiful
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
to gorge oneself/to eat heartily (idiom)
to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
gluttonous/greedy/to have a craving
to covet/envious
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
